title: DSA Level 10 â€” Dynamic Programming & Advanced
concept: Classical DP patterns: knapsack, LIS, LCS, DP on grids, bitmask DP.

challenges.title: 0/1 Knapsack
challenges.description: Given N items with values and weights and a capacity W, find the maximum total value you can get by choosing each item at most once.
challenges.inputDescription: First line: N W. Next N lines: value[i] weight[i].

challenges.title: Unbounded Knapsack
challenges.description: Same as Knapsack, but you can take an unlimited number of each item.
challenges.inputDescription: First line: N W. Next N lines: value[i] weight[i].

challenges.title: Longest Increasing Subsequence
challenges.description: Given an array, find the length of the longest strictly increasing subsequence.
challenges.inputDescription: First line: N. Second line: N integers.

challenges.title: Longest Common Subsequence
challenges.description: Given two strings A and B, compute the length of their Longest Common Subsequence (LCS).
challenges.inputDescription: First line: A. Second line: B.

challenges.title: Minimum Edit Distance
challenges.description: Compute the minimum number of insertions, deletions, or substitutions required to convert string A into string B.
challenges.inputDescription: First line: A. Second line: B.

challenges.title: Coin Change (Count Ways)
challenges.description: Given coins of different denominations and a total amount, count how many ways you can make that amount (order of coins does not matter).
challenges.inputDescription: First line: N amount. Second line: N coin values.

challenges.title: Matrix Chain Multiplication
challenges.description: Given dimensions of matrices, find the minimum number of scalar multiplications needed to multiply the chain.
challenges.inputDescription: First line: N (number of matrices). Second line: N+1 integers p0 p1 ... pN, where matrix i is p[i-1] x p[i].

challenges.title: Subset Sum DP
challenges.description: Given a set of integers and a target sum S, determine if there exists a subset with sum exactly S.
challenges.inputDescription: First line: N S. Second line: N integers.

challenges.title: Rod Cutting
challenges.description: Given a rod of length N and an array price[] where price[i] is price of length i+1, determine maximum obtainable value by cutting up the rod.
challenges.inputDescription: First line: N. Second line: N integers, price[1..N].

challenges.title: Travelling Salesman Problem (Bitmask DP)
challenges.description: Given a complete weighted graph on N nodes (0 to N-1), find the minimum cost Hamiltonian cycle starting and ending at node 0.
challenges.inputDescription: First line: N. Next N lines: N integers each (adjacency matrix, cost[i][j]).
